episodes.title: “I Followed Every Catholic Marriage Rule… Until I Realized the Harm" - An Ex-Catholic Wife's Story
episodes.description:
Join the private group discussion on discord for $1/m: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad

In this episode of Intrinsically Ordered, I sit down with Isabelle, who grew up immersed in traditional Catholicism—daily rosaries, novenas, and all. Over time, she shifted toward progressive Catholicism before beginning a slow and painful unraveling of belief. We talk about mental health, OCD masked as virtue, the reality of Catholic marriage and NFP, gender and sexuality, and the psychological manipulation baked into so many teachings. Isabelle shares how motherhood, philosophy, and her relationship with her non-Catholic husband helped her reclaim agency and begin truly living. It’s raw, real, and deeply moving.

episodes.title: How the Left Can Win Debates - Actual Jubilee Participants Talk About Their Experience
episodes.description:
Join the private group discussion on discord for $1/m: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad

In this episode of Intrinsically Ordered, I'm joined by Greg and Oliver—two seasoned left-wing voices who’ve appeared on Jubilee, the Whatever podcast, and in brutal six-hour debates with professional sexists, racists, and homophobes. Together, we unpack the ethics of debate, how to survive the emotional toll, what it’s like to be in the room with Jordan Peterson or Michael Knowles, and why the left can’t afford to stay silent anymore. Whether you're thinking of joining a debate or just curious how to counter the right-wing media machine, this is your crash course in becoming a better debater—without losing your mind, your values, or your sense of humor.

You can listen to this podcast on all major platforms - Spotify, Apple, Amazon, and more - 'Intrinsically Ordered'

episodes.title: Gay, Catholic, and OnlyFans Star: Darian Black's Story of Reconciling Faith and Sexuality
episodes.description:
Join the private group discussion on discord for $1/m: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad

I sat down with Darian, a gay creator who once wanted to be a Catholic priest and now runs an OnlyFans—while still attending Mass. We talked about scrupulosity, being queer in the church, spirituality beyond dogma, and the surprising peace he found in ritual. Darian's story is messy, funny, thoughtful, and deeply honest—and it challenges what it means to be both gay and Catholic in a polarized world.

You can follow Darian on instagram and tikTok - https://www.instagram.com/darianblackofficial/

This podcast is available on all major platforms (Spotify, apple, amazon, etc.) as 'Intrinsically Ordered'

episodes.title: Two Atheists Go to a Latin Mass - Behind  @HeliocentricOfficial's 'Atheist Church Audit'
episodes.description:

Jared from Heliocentric joins me to talk about his experience attending a Latin Mass for the first time and what it reveals about the explosive growth of Rad Trad Catholicism online. We dive into the aesthetics, the online media machine, the psychology of conversion, and how social media fuels religious radicalization. We also reflect on sexuality, the pain of being gay in the Church, and our shared experiences with Jordan Peterson. This one goes deep.

episodes.title: Coming Out As Gay In Canadian Catholic Hockey Culture - @bradyvandruenen's Story
episodes.description:
Join the community and join the group discussion on discord: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad

I got to sit down with @bradyvandruenen55 , a former Catholic school student and hockey player from small-town Canada, to hear his powerful story of growing up gay in a conservative Catholic environment. We dive into Catholic sex ed, hockey locker room culture, the mental gymnastics of trying to be someone you're not, and what it was like to finally break free and come out. This one’s for anyone who’s ever felt trapped by faith, family, or fear.

episodes.title: Being Gay At The Most Conservative Catholic Universities - Newman Guide -  @leavelaughlove ​
episodes.description:
In this episode of Intrinsically Ordered, Cade chats with Evelyn from Leave Laugh Love about the hidden world of Newman Guide colleges — those elite, ultra-conservative Catholic universities designed to "protect" young adults from the real world. Evelyn shares her experience attending Franciscan University, the cult-like enforcement of Catholic morality, the double lives queer students are forced to live, and the gaslighting that comes with leaving. We dive into everything from purity culture to fake academic rigor, campus surveillance, and why these colleges are obsessed with Jordan Peterson and Lila Rose. If you’re wondering whether these schools are holy havens or Catholic cults — this episode is for you.

episodes.title: Eucharistic Miracles Are FAKE - Actual Scientist Review "Scientific Evidence" of Catholic Miracle Claims w/  @Nontradicath ​
episodes.description:
Join the community and join the group discussion on discord: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad

I’m joined by Kevin for a deep dive into one of Catholicism’s most emotionally compelling and scientifically dubious claims: Eucharistic miracles. You’ve heard the stories—bread turning into heart tissue, bleeding hosts, and baffled scientists—but how well do these claims hold up to scrutiny?

Kevin walks us through the actual studies (or lack thereof), the role of contamination, misleading narratives, and the difference between scientific integrity and religious marketing. We talk Lonciano, Buenos Aires, and Tlaxcala, plus the Catholic scientists themselves who have started to speak out.

If you’ve ever felt guilt-tripped into staying Catholic because of these miracles—or you just want to understand the facts—this episode is for you.

00:34 Popular Eucharistic Miracle Claims

45:40 Dr. Kiers' Experiment and Findings
48:05 Dr. Trian Cos' Skepticism

58:55 Conclusion and Final Thoughts

episodes.title: Why Jordan Peterson Made Me An Atheist
episodes.description: Jordan Peterson is famous for inspiring many to take religion seriously — but for me, he had the opposite effect. In this video, I walk you through how reading Maps of Meaning turned me from a devout Catholic who almost became a priest into an atheist — and how Peterson’s ideas unexpectedly helped me accept myself as a gay man. We'll dive into belief, metaphorical substrates, value hierarchies, meta-narratives, and why I eventually walked away from Peterson too. Strap in — it’s a journey. 00:00 Discovering Jordan Peterson's Work 03:26 Realizing Natural Explanations for Religious Benefits 05:03 Understanding Peterson's Concept of God 08:07 Metaphorical Substrate and Its Influence 09:46 The Power of Stories and Archetypes 15:35 Meta-Narratives: Finding Purpose and Direction 17:43 Questioning the Need for a Supernatural God 18:50 The Role of Belief in Religion 25:54 Embracing My Sexuality: Peterson's Indirect Influence 28:58 Why I Left Jordan Peterson Behind 30:32 Critique of Peterson's Views and Methods 34:11 Conclusion: Life Beyond Dogma To join our discord community for $1 or to support my work/get early access to content, check out my patreon: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad To be a guest on the episode, visit my YT channel and send me an email.

episodes.title: Was Pope Francis Really an LGBT Ally? A Critical Analysis
episodes.description:
In this critical follow-up to our earlier reflections on Pope Francis’s passing, three gay ex-Catholics break down the truth behind the progressive myth. While headlines hail him as a revolutionary, we ask: did anything actually change for queer Catholics? From catechism clauses to conversion therapy, brunch with trans folks to doctrinal silence—this episode confronts the carefully curated optics of compassion.

We’re not here to hate—just to tell the truth. What could have changed? What stayed the same? What harm still hides behind a smile? Tune in to hear three ex-believers decode the Vatican’s most PR-friendly pope.

episodes.title: Pope Francis LGBTQ Legacy? What He Did (and Didn’t Do) for Us
episodes.description:
Pope Francis has passed—and within hours, I sat down with Justin from Empty Chairs for an off-the-cuff emergency podcast. As a gay ex-Catholic and a gay current Catholic, we unpack Pope Francis’s complicated legacy on LGBTQ issues. Did he really change anything? Did he do enough? Or was it all just nice-sounding words with no lasting impact?

We talk about our own experiences inside the Church, from being denied vocations to being fired for our sexuality. We also dive into the real theological documents vs. the media narrative, and what the Church might look like under the next Pope.

If you want an honest, emotionally raw, and well-informed queer Catholic perspective—you’re in the right place.

episodes.title: What Does Pope Francis' Death Mean for LGBT Catholics?
episodes.description: Pope Francis has passed. And as someone who was once on the path to becoming a conservative Catholic priest—and now lives openly as a gay man—his death hits hard. In this video, I break down what Pope Francis actually did for LGBTQ Catholics. From his famous “Who am I to judge?” to his quiet yet revolutionary support of queer ministries, this pope changed the vibe of the church, even if he never changed the doctrine. For outsiders, it may be hard to grasp how radical just saying “You are welcome here” really was. In this episode, I reflect on his legacy, what’s at stake in the election of the next pope, and why so many LGBTQ Catholics now feel uncertain and afraid. If you want to join the conversation, hop in my Discord or support this work on Patreon 00:00 Introduction and Personal Background 00:36 Pope Francis' Approach to LGBTQ Issues 01:04 Key Moments and Quotes from Pope Francis 01:45 Pope Francis' Actions 02:35 Impact on LGBTQ Catholics 04:02 Pope Francis' Legacy and Media Strategy 06:33 Concerns About the Future of the Church 09:08 Final Thoughts and Call to Action To join our discord community for $1 or to support my work/get early access to content, check out my patreon: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad To be a guest on the episode, visit my YT channel and send me an email.

episodes.title: the STRANGEST anti-gay philosophical arguments I've ever heard - w/  @Kenapologeticscatholic ​
episodes.description:
In this episode of the Intrinsically Ordered Podcast, I sit down with Minh @Kenapologeticscatholic  a Catholic apologist and street evangelist, for one of the most intense and philosophical debates I’ve had on the show. We dive deep into the question of homosexuality from Catholic, secular, and philosophical angles—covering everything from natural law, metaethics, and sexual ethics to kink, bestiality, and gender abolition.

As a queer ex-Catholic, I challenge Minh on the idea that gay sex is somehow less moral or meaningful. Minh presents two dense arguments based on Catholic philosophy—and I try to pull them apart with both real-world data and a more progressive ethical lens.

This one isn’t for the faint of heart—but it’s a vital, rigorous discussion about what it means to be moral, sexual, and human.

YouTube: youtube.com/@kenapologeticscatholic
Instagram: kenio02
Gmail: minhhoangkinhthanh@gmail.com
Discord: kenapologeticscatholic

episodes.title: Why I Treat Homophobic Christians Like Vegans
episodes.description: In today's episode, I unpack the mental model I use when Christians try to impose their beliefs—especially around queer rights. I compare their moral arguments to veganism (yes, really) to show how the more forcefully someone wants to control others, the more evidence they need to bring to the table. Faith alone doesn’t cut it. I walk through four levels of moral imperatives and the kind of proof each one demands. From personal convictions to theocratic dogma, I explain why your certainty should match your evidence—especially if you're trying to take away my rights. This isn’t just theology—it’s epistemology. 00:00 – I Treat Homophobic Christians Like Vegans 00:30 – What Counts as a Moral Imperative? 01:00 – My Journey: From Latin Mass to Deconstruction 01:36 – Level 1: Personal Belief Requires No Proof 02:57 – Level 2: Gentle Advocacy Needs Some Evidence 05:02 – Level 3: Telling Others What to Do? Prove It. 07:46 – Level 4: Forcing Belief = Irrefutable Proof Required 10:50 – Don't Get Stuck in the Weeds—Know the Burden 13:00 – Final Advice for Deconstructing Listeners To join our discord community for $1 or to support my work/get early access to content, check out my patreon: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad To be a guest on the episode, visit my YT channel and send me an email.

episodes.title: How to Leave Catholicism/High-Control Religion & Stay Happy w/ Evelyn from Leave Laugh Love
episodes.description:
Leaving a fundamentalist or conservative form of Catholicism is more than just walking away from a church—it’s walking away from an entire worldview, identity, and sometimes your community. In this episode of Intrinsically Ordered, Evelyn from the podcast Leave Laugh Love joins us for an honest, vulnerable, and occasionally funny conversation about leaving faith as a queer person. We talk about the emotional process of leaving, what healing looks like, building a new life, and practical steps for anyone questioning their faith. Whether you’re deconstructing, doubting, or just curious, this is for you.

episodes.title: 101 Ways to Go To Hell in Catholicism (And Why It Makes No Sense)
episodes.description: In this episode, I discuss my journey from being a traditional Catholic to questioning and ultimately leaving the faith. I delve into the ambiguities and contradictions within Catholic teachings about sin and morality. Sharing personal stories, I highlight the lack of clarity on what actions might lead someone to hell. Using a Spider-Man meme analogy, I illustrate the contradictory views held by different Catholic authorities. I question the Church's claims of having definitive answers to moral issues, pointing out the inconsistencies and confusion among priests and church documents. Join me as I explore these complexities and talk about how my life has improved since moving away from fundamentalist Catholicism. 00:00 Introduction: A Personal Story 00:33 Questioning Catholic Teachings 00:56 About the Channel 01:18 Understanding Catholic Sins 03:20 The Spider-Man Meme: Illustrating Contradictions 04:43 The Confusion of Catholic Doctrine 05:55 The Gray Areas of Morality 07:59 The Subjectivity of Sin 09:24 Conclusion: Moving Beyond Traditional Catholicism To join our discord community for $1 or to support my work/get early access to content, check out my patreon: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad To be a guest on the episode, visit my YT channel and send me an email.

episodes.title: What Sends You to Hell in Catholicism? Apologist & Atheist Debate Catholic Teaching
episodes.description:
Catholic YouTuber and apologist @CameronRiecker  joins us to explore the murky waters of morality, mortal sin, and the ever-evolving landscape of Catholic teaching. From oral contraception to yoga pants, we tackle the gray areas where the Church hasn't definitively ruled, and how Catholics are supposed to navigate them. We discuss the role of Church authority, personal conscience, historical precedent, and why ambiguity might be part of God’s plan. Whether you're a believer, skeptic, or somewhere in between, this conversation is a deep dive into the science of morality and the struggle for clarity in faith.

episodes.title: The False Promises of Traditional Catholicism - Inside Catholicism's Most Radical Sect
episodes.description: Join the community and join the group discussion on discord: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad As someone who was once a zealous traditional Catholic—praying daily rosaries, attending Latin Mass, and even discerning monastic life—I've since deconverted and now reflect critically on the movement from personal experience. This isn’t a theological takedown. It’s a candid, off-the-cuff reflection on what I saw inside the movement, why it appeals to so many (especially young people and converts), and the serious questions it raises about growth, retention, and cultural relevance. We’ll cover: Why the movement feels powerful but might not be sustainable, the illusion of rapid growth in Latin Mass parishes, why many kids raised traditionally still leave the Church, the tight link between American conservatism and traditional Catholicism, how convert zeal often idealizes tradition without fully understanding it, whether you’re deep in the trad world, newly curious, or trying to make sense of what’s happening in the Church today, I hope this video gives you something to think about. 00:00 Personal Background and Deconversion 00:48 Setting the Stage: Traditional Catholicism 02:26 The Appeal and Growth of the Movement 02:58 Why This Topic Matters 03:36 Personal Journey Through Traditional Catholicism 05:39 Lack of Data and Personal Observations 06:52 Illusion of Traditional Growth 10:18 Retention and Conversion Issues 12:24 Geographical and Political Context 16:27 Convert Dominated Movement 19:23 Mental Health and Traditionalism 21:57 Interpersonal Issues in the Movement 22:43 Surface Level Kindness and Parish Politics 25:21 Cult-like Dynamics and Isolation 26:58 Performative Holiness and Scrupulosity 29:58 Intellectualism and Apologetics 31:59 Misconceptions of Happiness and Fulfillment 39:44 Conclusion and Final Thoughts To join our discord community for $1 or to support my work/get early access to content, check out my patreon: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad To be a guest on the episode, visit my YT channel and send me an email.

episodes.title: Christians, What if Being Gay Were a Choice?
episodes.description: For years, I begged God to make me straight. I read every book, watched every lecture, and tried every method of "healing." But what if being queer isn’t something to fix? What if it's something you could choose — not out of rebellion, but out of love, honesty, and freedom? In this deeply personal episode, I reflect on my journey from internalized homophobia to joyful self-acceptance, from Catholic doctrine to queer community. We explore the concept of identity, the weight of “coming out,” and what it really means to choose love — without conditions. 00:00 – I Begged God to Make Me Straight 01:23 – Would I Choose to Be Straight Now? 02:07 – Growing Up Catholic and Closeted 03:01 – “I Am” vs. “I Experience” 04:13 – Why Christians Fear the Words “I Am Gay” 05:14 – Identity, Honesty, and the Label “Queer” 07:42 – The Fork in the Road: Queer vs. Christian Paths 10:09 – Why I Chose the Queer Path — And Found Life To join our discord community for $1 or to support my work/get early access to content, check out my patreon: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad To be a guest on the episode, visit my YT channel and send me an email.

episodes.title: Catholicism & Gay Marriage Debate: Natural Law, Ethics, and Legal Considerations in a Modern Society
episodes.description:
I got to sit down with a professional catholic apologist to have perhaps the most comprehensive discussion on natural law & gay marriage. We originally planned an hour discussion on a number of topics but found enough to get into just on this issue - and then went for almost two hours. I enjoyed having a thoughtful, long-form discussion on such an emotional topic. Joe's liked talking enough with me that he'll be posted the entire conversation on his channel - so perhaps we'll have an influx of dialogues with other prominent apologists.

episodes.title: Catholic Sacraments Make No Logical Sense: Placebo, Ritual, and Boundary Maintenance
episodes.description:
Support this work: patreon.com/c/gayextrad

Are Catholic sacraments truly channels of divine grace—or just powerful human rituals? In this episode of Intrinsically Ordered, we question the supernatural claims behind sacraments like baptism and marriage. With guest Colin, we explore their historical roots, psychological impact, and striking similarities to rituals in other cultures. From a botched baptism to the Church’s evolving rules, we unpack what these rites really mean and why they matter. Join us for a critical, respectful look at belief, ritual, and the fine line between faith and magic.

(00:00) - Critique of Catholic Sacraments
(07:35) - Deeper Understanding of Catholic Sacraments
(19:49) - Exploring Catholic Sacraments and Belief

(35:47) - Development of Catholic Sacraments
(39:50) - Sacraments as Ritual Magic
(44:52) - Significance of Catholic Rituals
(51:11) - Religious Unity and Understanding

episodes.title: Catholic Apologist vs Ex-Catholic Atheist: Evidence for God, Morality, and Catholic Infallibility
episodes.description:
Does faith require evidence, or is experience enough? In this episode of Intrinsically Ordered, I sit down with Noah from @Jesus_and_Whatnot  to debate Catholicism, the role of suffering, religious disagreement, and whether faith can be rationally justified. We dive into the toughest questions:

Does the Catholic Church have clear moral teachings, or is it all contradiction?
Why does God allow suffering, and is it truly necessary?
If the Pope is infallible, why do Catholics disagree on so much?
What would it take for an atheist to believe in God again?

🔥 This discussion goes deep into Catholic apologetics, philosophical arguments, and the personal journeys that shape our beliefs. Whether you're Catholic, atheist, or somewhere in between, this episode will challenge your thinking!

02:15 – What Led You to Question Catholicism?
08:30 – The Problem of Religious Disagreement

21:45 – The Role of the Pope in Resolving Confusion
28:20 – Does Faith Require Evidence?
34:10 – Why Does God Allow Suffering?
41:00 – The Catholic Church’s Rules on Marriage & Morality
48:30 – If God is Real, Why Doesn’t He Make Himself Clear?
55:40 – Can the Church Even Define Mortal Sin?
1:02:25 – Why Doesn’t the Pope Answer Dubia (Doctrinal Questions)?
1:08:45 – What Would Convince an Atheist to Believe Again?
1:14:00 – Does Religion Make Life Better or Worse?
1:19:30 – Is Catholicism’s Appeal Just Suffering & Submission?
1:22:10 – Final Thoughts & Wrap-Up

episodes.title: 5 Things That Would Make Me Believe in God - Ex-Catholic Atheist On Divine Hiddenness & Interstellar
episodes.description: After years of grappling with this question, I finally have an answer—thanks to Interstellar. This film unknowingly lays out the six conditions that could actually convince me a higher intelligence exists. But even if that were true… would it lead me to religion? Join me as I break down the philosophy, science, and religious implications behind Interstellar’s mysterious guiding force—and why it’s still a better "God" than any religious claim I’ve ever heard. 00:00 - My Journey from Catholicism to Atheism 00:24 - Interstellar and the Idea of God 01:17 - The Ghost in Interstellar: A Clear Communication 02:48 - The First Condition: Intelligent, Direct Communication 05:16 - The Second Condition: Supernatural but Measurable Events 06:12 - The Third Condition: Useful, Non-Trivial Knowledge 07:37 - The Problem of Divine Hiddenness 09:03 - Even If God Exists, Religion Still Fails 10:51 - The Leap from God to Religious Dogma To join our discord community for $1 or to support my work/get early access to content, check out my patreon: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad To be a guest on the episode, visit my YT channel and send me an email.

episodes.title: I Debated Michael Knowles on Jubilee - Yes, Gay Marriage CAN Exist - DEBUNKING Bad Conservative Philosophy
episodes.description: In this video, I break down my debate with Michael Knowles on Jubilee about the topic of same-sex marriage, philosophy, and conservative ideology. We go deep into metaphysics, logic, and how anti-LGBT arguments are structured to sound airtight—but fall apart under scrutiny. Michael and I come from the same religious movement, and I used to believe the same things he argues today. But as I studied philosophy and deconstructed my faith, I realized just how flimsy these arguments are. Stick with me as we explore nominalism vs. realism, the Texas sharpshooter fallacy, and why Michael’s claims on metaphysical reality don’t hold up. This video will equip you to counter these arguments in everyday conversations and protect our rights from bad-faith actors. 00:00 - Introduction: My Debate with Michael Knowles 02:30 - The Core Argument: Does Gay Marriage Exist? 06:45 - Michael’s First Mistake: The Realism vs. Nominalism Trap 11:20 - The Texas Sharpshooter Fallacy: Cherry-Picking History 15:55 - Why Metaphysics Can’t Define Legal Marriage 21:10 - The Logical Impossibility Fallacy (And Why It’s B.S.) 26:40 - Why Michael’s Argument is Ultimately Religious, Not Logical 32:15 - Final Thoughts: How to Counter These Arguments IRL To join our discord community for $1 or to support my work/get early access to content, check out my patreon: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad To be a guest on the episode, visit my YT channel and send me an email.

episodes.title: The WEIRD Reason The Catholic Church Wants To Control Your Sex Life -  Trent Horn  Debunked
episodes.description: Catholic apologist Trent Horn recently posted a video titled "The Sex Questions Almost No One Can Answer", where he attempts to justify Catholic sexual ethics using Natural Law philosophy. But are these arguments sound? Join my discord for $1/m: patreon.com/c/gayextrad As a former devout Catholic and apologist, I break down the flaws in this ideology and show how these outdated beliefs impact real people—through shame, control, and even political legislation. From ‘intrinsic evils’ to absurd rules on contraception, let's talk about why these arguments don't hold up and why you don’t have to buy into them. If you enjoy this content and want to support my work, join my Patreon for exclusive access to my Discord community of ex-Catholics, queer folks, and free thinkers. Let's have these conversations where they matter. episodes.title: Finding Meaning Without God: Running A Thousand Miles, Secular Buddhism, Addiction, and Trauma
episodes.description: In this episode of Intrinsically Ordered, I sit down with Jason—a long-time friend, ultramarathoner, and secular Buddhist—to explore life beyond dogma. We dive deep into questions of meaning, suffering, and personal transformation. Jason shares his journey from childhood trauma, addiction, and depression to healing, self-acceptance, and the liberating philosophy of secular Buddhism. We tackle the fear of leaving behind rigid belief systems, the reality of self-imposed suffering, and the beauty of finding your own path. Whether you’re deconstructing faith, seeking purpose, or just curious about running 200+ miles through the wilderness, this conversation is for you. 🔹 The illusion of certainty in religion 🔹 What it really means to "find yourself" 🔹 The power of suffering as a teacher 🔹 Ultramarathons as a metaphor for life 🔹 Reframing trauma and choosing a new narrative If you’ve ever questioned what’s next after faith—or just want to hear an incredible journey of resilience—this episode is a must-listen. Timestamps: 00:00 – Introduction & Guest Introduction 01:18 – Why People Fear Leaving Religion 03:06 – What If Life Has No Meaning? 05:00 – Creating Meaning vs. Finding It 10:59 – The Role of Suffering in Growth 15:31 – How Religion Becomes a Coping Mechanism 17:30 – Hitting Rock Bottom: Alcoholism & Trauma 22:40 – Running From Pain vs. Facing It 29:09 – The Turning Point: Therapy & Healing 33:56 – How Trauma Affects the Brain 40:17 – The Difference Between Pain & Suffering 41:44 – Living in the Present: The Power of Mindfulness 47:10 – What Therapy is REALLY Like 50:48 – Running 250 Miles—Why Choose to Suffer? 54:55 – The Mental Side of Ultra-Endurance 59:46 – The Freedom of Letting Go 1:04:05 – Choosing Your Own Path & Building Community 1:10:22 – Finding Belonging Outside of Religion 1:12:03 – How to Start Living YOUR Life Today 1:28:18 – Final Thoughts & Takeaways To join our discord community for $1 or to support my work/get early access to content, check out my patreon: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad To be a guest on the episode, visit my YT channel and send me an email.

But in all seriousness, Jason Evert is the Final Boss of catholic apologists who do nothing but create word salads to confuse people and pad church teaching. episodes.description: Father Mike Schmitz (celebrity catholic priest) uses chairs to demonstrate teleology, and then makes anti-gay arguments from Theology of the Body. This approach fails in so many ways, and I don't think chairs are our best proof of teleology. I (a gay ex-traditional catholic apologist) give my reaction to his wild takes on teleology. episodes.title: Gay Catholics: Ask These 5 Questions to Find Peace
episodes.description: I've left religion entirely, but Justin from @EmptyChairsHome has found peace in reconciling his catholic faith and his sexuality. I hope Justin's thoughts can help those of you who choose to stay in religion. You can find Justin on all social platforms as @emptychairshome and at https://empty-chairs.org. To join our discord community for $1, check out my patreon:https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad Chapters 0:00 - Justin's Background 1:02 - The Five Key Questions 1:54 - 1. Who Is God? 7:20 - 2. What Does the Church Say? 14:48 - 3. What’s the Life I Want to Give God? 20:01 - 4. What Does Psychology Say? 25:05 - 5. Jesus, Can I Do This? 28:00 - Advice for Those Struggling with Faith and Sexuality 31:39 - What’s Next for Justin and Empty Chairs?

episodes.title: The Absurdity of Catholic Spiritual Warfare: Cult Control Tactics & Unfalsifiable Hypotheses
episodes.description: Colin is working on a video on spiritual warfare in conservative/traditional catholicism, so we sat down this morning to talk through what spiritual warfare is, how it control peoples, some psychological ideas of why it takes a hold on folks, how it's used to influence politics, some internal consistencies, and some other things. Yes, this video is directly attacking church teaching and is quite condescending. Why? This teaching, more than almost any other, destroys peoples' lives and takes away peoples' rights. I'm a fan of people choosing religious beliefs that work for them, but this realm is perhaps one of the worst parts of catholicism. Hence, the forceful speaking out. To support this work, get early access, and join my discord community, please consider supporting me on patreon: patreon.com/c/gayextrad If you want to be on the show, send me an email! (available on my YT channel)

episodes.title: Catholic Conversion Therapy, Homophobia in Ordination, and Starting an Independent Church Plant: Andrew's Story
episodes.description:
In this powerful and candid episode of The Intrinsically Ordered Podcast, we sit down with Andrew, a former Catholic with deep roots in the faith, now part of the Anglican Church. Andrew shares his story of growing up in a devout Catholic family, grappling with his identity as a queer man, and his transformative journey navigating homophobia within the Church.

0:00 Intro
1:45 Andrew’s Catholic Upbringing
7:30 Coming Out in a Religious Family
12:15 Navigating Homophobia in Youth Groups
18:40 Conversion Therapy and Its Impact
24:55 Seminary Life: Challenges and Lessons
32:10 Leaving Catholicism for Anglicanism
39:50 Reconciling Faith and Sexuality
46:35 Andrew’s Spiritual Practices Today
51:10 Advice for Others on Their Journey
55:00 Closing Reflections

To get early access to episodes, join our private discord community, and support this work, consider joining my patreon: patreon.com/c/gayextrad

To be a guest on the episode, visit my shoot me an email.

episodes.title: Answering Trent Horn's 'Questions Liberals Can't Answer' - Non-Catholic Answers Ep 1
episodes.description: Trent Horn, a catholic apologist for Catholic Answers and host of the Counsel of Trent show, published a talk recently at Young Americans for Freedom called '7 Questions Liberals Can't Answer.' I hopped on a call with Veronica from the Leave Laugh Love podcast and my two friends Ben & Colin to respond to some of Trent's questions on socialism, gay marriage, contraception, transgenderism, MAID, and abortion. Myself and co-host in this episode are all ex-catholic is varying degrees. All opinions are each individual's own (including my own crazy takes). To join the show on a future episode or submit content for us to react to, shoot me an email (available on my YT channel) or Patreon. To support this work in fighting radical catholicism, get early access to episodes, and join my discord of ex/current catholics, consider supporting me on patreon: patreon.com/c/gayextrad

episodes.title: Being a Queer Woman of Color in Traditional Catholicism & Using Witchcraft to Heal: Therese's Story
episodes.description: Therese was born into a FSSP parish. She has many good memories, but also many bad memories from her time: an overbearing mother, purity culture, being in the closet, and catholic dating. But now, Therese is living her best life after deconstructing - experiencing the world, practicing witchcraft, and falling in love. Today, Colin and I sat down with Therese to hear her story and thoughts on life. It was an honor getting to hear her story. To join our community of ex/current catholics, get early access to videos, and support this work, consider supporting me on patreon: patreon.com/c/gayextrad. If you'd like to be on the show, please email me - contact info on my YT channel. I'd love to hear your story and thoughts on the world!

episodes.title: Queer Folks Are a Danger to the Catholic Church's 'Infallible' Magisterium
episodes.description: The Catholic Church promises 'true peace' to all who follow Him, but what do you do when you don't? What if your existence and wellbeing run contrary to this path that contains the 'fullness of the truth?' Today, I had a longer discussion with my friend Colin (gay, raised FSSP) and Astronaut (gay, former cleric) about my last video 'The Catholic Church Doesn't Know What to Do With Gay People.' The Intrinsically Ordered Podcast is available on all major podcast platforms and explores the intersection of queer identity and catholicism - sharing stories of those who've left, remained, and created their own journeys; providing commentary on the catholic church's harmful teachings; helping those who've been hurt. To get early access to new episodes, submit questions to guests, and support this work, consider supporting me on patreon: patreon.com/c/gayextrad 00:02:00 - Queer Identity and the Church's Structure 00:10:00 - Emotional Impact of Catholicism 00:33:27 - Gay Priests 00:44:12 - Intimacy & Sexuality 00:52:32 - Philosophical Dilemmas 01:02:35 - Navigating Logic Mazes in Theology 01:12:02 - Should You Stay Catholic To be a guest on the show or to contact, email can be found in channel information

episodes.title: Why I Stay Catholic as a Gay Man - Chris Dowling-Magill Interview
episodes.description: I sat down with Chris Dowling to hear his story of loosing his job after coming out, why he still stays religious, how he lives out of the fruits of the spirit, and his upcoming two-year anniversary of being married. To connect with Chris and hear more of his work, make sure to follow him on Instagram and Facebook. To support interviews like this, consider supporting my work on Patreon and gain early access to new episodes: patreon.com/gaytradspeaks. I have Simon Kent Fung (creator of Dear Alana), Justin ('EmptyChairsHome' on social media), and a number of other guests lined up to be on the podcast. The goal of this podcast format is to to hear stories of people at the intersection of queer identity and religion. I've shared plenty about my story and my own thoughts on my main channel, but I wanted to create a second channel dedicated to hearing others' stories - remaining in the church, leaving the church, finding a more accepting denomination, etc. Hopefully these stories can give you more of a perspective and help you make decisions for your faith journey. If you'd like to be on the podcast, feel free to reach out - contact info is on my channel, or send me a DM.
